series_description: This series documents moneys to be paid by the agency to its creditors. The series may include, but is not limited to: receipts, bills, canceled checks, returned checks, check registers, and checking statements.
retention_statement: 3 Years after end of state fiscal year

series_description: This series documents moneys owed to the agency by its debtors. The series may include, but is not limited to: bills, invoices, receipts, deposit slips, and reimbursement documentation.
retention_statement: 3 Years after end of state fiscal year

series_description: This series documents the appropriations from the state treasury and other sources.
retention_statement: 3 Years after end of state fiscal year

series_description: This series documents the audit of an agency completed by an outside auditor, such as the Auditor of Public Accounts (APA). This series may include, but is not limited to: working papers and prepared audit report.
retention_statement: 5 Years after end of state fiscal year

series_description: This series documents the audit of the agency's financial by its own internal auditors or staff. This series may include, is not limited to: working papers and prepared audit report.
retention_statement: 3 Years after end of state fiscal year

series_description: This series documents the issuance of bonds to fund capital projects, payments made by a fiscal/paying agent due to bond issues, and the destruction of bonds and bond coupons paid the fiscal/paying agent. This series may include, but is not limited to: transfer statements, bond destruction certificates, bond issue and payment documentation
retention_statement: 3 Years after last action

series_description: This series documents the agency's work to establish a This series may include, but is not limited to: working papers and forecasts.
retention_statement: 3 Years after end of state fiscal year

series_description: This series documents financial transactions within the This series may include, but is not limited to: cash reports, transmittal and settlement records, warrant records, bank statements, and reconciliation documentation.
retention_statement: 3 Years after end of state fiscal year

series_description: This series documents contracts and agreements entered into by the agency. This series may include, but is not limited to: contract and supporting documentation.
retention_statement: 5 Years after expiration

series_description: This series documents the financial transactions related to a capital improvement. This series may include, but is not limited to: contracts, agreements, and reports generated by the Department of Accounts (DOA).
retention_statement: 0 Years after equipment, facility, or property sold or no longer in use

series_description: This series documents regulatory compliance and accuracy in transaction processing, such as tracking of income and expenditures. This series may include, but is not limited to: Agency Risk Management and Internal Control Standards (ARMICS) documentation.
retention_statement: 3 Years after end of state fiscal year

series_description: This series documents the control of fixed assets, such a land, buildings, and equipment, owned by the agency. This series may include, but is not limited to: inventories and reconciliation documents.
retention_statement: 3 Years after end of state fiscal year

series_description: This series documents the assets, liabilities, fund balances, revenues, and expenses of the agency. This series may but is not limited to: journals and ledgers.

This series documents the annual financial management of state, federal, and/or private grant projects participated in or awarded/administered by state agencies that do not contain contractual terms for records retention. This series may but is not limited to: accounts payables and receivables, drawdown requests, and fiscal reports.
retention_statement: 3 Years after end of state fiscal year

series_description: This series documents insurance coverage carried by the agency such as unemployment insurance. This series may include, but is not limited to: insurance policies, claims, and investment files.
retention_statement: 3 Years after end of state fiscal year

series_description: This series documents the tracking and control of agency property, equipment, and supplies. This series may include, is not limited to: journals and reports.
retention_statement: 3 Years after end of state fiscal year

series_description: This series documents the payroll activities of the agency. This series may include, but is not limited to: deduction authorizations and registers, leave records, ledgers and compensation files, retirement contributions, time and attendance records, and time sheets.
retention_statement: 5 Years after end of state fiscal year

series_description: This series documents the purchasing of equipment, goods, services, and supplies by the agency. This series may include, but is not limited to: bids, bid proposals, contracts, purchase orders, and requisitions.
retention_statement: 5 Years after end of state fiscal year

series_description: This series documents the receiving of good, supplies and equipment by the agency.
retention_statement: 3 Years after end of state fiscal year

series_description: This series documents the reimbursement of money to or from the agency. This series may include, but is not limited to: travel expense reimbursement and overpayment documentation.
retention_statement: 3 Years after end of state fiscal year

series_description: This series documents the participation of the agency in the Virginia Retirement System.
retention_statement: 3 Years after end of state fiscal year

series_title: Signature Cards This series authorizes individuals to have signatory rights in handling various financial transactions for the agency.
retention_statement: 3 Years after superseded, obsolete, or rescinded

series_description: This series documents the disposition of property by the that has been declared as surplus and no longer needed for use. This series may include, but is not limited to: bill of sale and supporting documentation.
retention_statement: 3 Years after end of state fiscal year

series_description: This series documents the claims for tax exemption received and granted by the agency. This series may include, but is not limited to: claims files and reports.
retention_statement: 5 Years after end of state fiscal year

series_description: This series documents the agency's banking transactions relating to trust funds. This series may include, but is not to: bank and payroll documents, receipts, and time and attendance documentation.
retention_statement: 3 Years after end of state fiscal year

series_description: This series documents the reporting of uncashed checks and credit balances held by the agency. This series may include, is not limited to: holder report and remittance submitted to the Virginia Department of the Treasury, Division of Unclaimed Property
retention_statement: 5 Years after end of state fiscal year

series_description: This series documents the information of vendors and that provide goods and services. This series may include, but not limited to: correspondence, W-9 and 1099 forms, Internal Revenue Service Taxpayer Identification Number (IRS TIN) match form, alternate payment address notice, and Automatic Clearing House (ACH) payment form.
retention_statement: 0 Years after no longer administratively useful

series_description: This series documents claims filed based on work-related or illness. This series may include, but is not limited to: claims, application for benefits, wage documents used to determine compensation, and payment documentation.
retention_statement: 5 Years after end of state fiscal year
